posts.cooked:
Hi all,

My team and I are currently designing our dashboard for this year’s competition. We’re trying to decide which platform would be a better experience, and I was looking for some more opinions.

Currently, we have a tab with diagnostic information such as our motor speeds, temperature, PDP current, etc. We also have a tab for our drive station where we have our camera, round info, autonomous, etc.

I’ve been watching the development of Elastic for a while now and I’m pleased with the progress that’s been happening on it so far, I just can’t tell if it’s developed enough to be something we should switch over to. When we tried Elastic for a demo run, our camera had poor FPS and was very delayed compared to Shuffleboard which was almost flawless. I’d like to switch to Elastic, I just can’t tell if it’s ready yet though.

Please let me know what you guys think because Shuffleboard has been extremely buggy as well but Elastic has also been buggy, so I just can’t decide which platform would best fit our needs. Let me know what you guys use too, I’m curious as to what teams are switching to nowadays.

posts.name: Jimmy McCosker
posts.cooked: Elastic will do everything shuffleboard can do and more at better performance (and less memory leaks)

Is there a specific reason that Elastic would be lagging heavily once my Limelight 2 is connected? It performs fine on Shuffleboard, but when I go to Elastic it’s just lagging. I’d be more than happy to make the switch to Elastic if I could figure out what’s going on with the camera situation.

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked:
StarManTheGamer:

When we tried Elastic for a demo run, our camera had poor FPS and was very delayed compared to Shuffleboard which was almost flawless.

This was an issue identified earlier in the season which has since been patched:

Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things

A critical issue was fixed where not all images were properly processed in an image stream, leading to low FPS, miscalculated bandwidth, and invalid images/glitch effects.

Camera stream performance should significantly improve.

I’m glad your team is considering using Elastic!

Although I am biased towards Elastic (since I made it), one major benefit of it compared to Shuffleboard besides the UI and performance improvements is its more active state of development. Shuffleboard has been essentially unmaintained since several of its original developers moved on from WPILib. Several newer developments in FRC such as swerve widgets or NT4 (partially completed this year but had some issues) haven’t been fully implemented. There’s also some new features used in Elastic that will become standardized with the new robot controller, remote layout downloading is one prime example.

link_counts.title: Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things

posts.name: Tyler Veness
posts.cooked:
Gold87:

Shuffleboard has been essentially unmaintained since several of its original developers moved on from WPILib

To underscore this point, attempts to improve the shuffleboard codebase for 2025 were reverted due to instability that no one could troubleshoot:

Puncture the bloat balloon by SamCarlberg · Pull Request #807 · wpilibsuite/shuffleboard · GitHub

Fix network tables by SamCarlberg · Pull Request #815 · wpilibsuite/shuffleboard · GitHub

posts.name: Jade
posts.cooked: Elastic hands down not even a question. The experience is soooo much better

posts.name: Arshan
posts.cooked:
In the past we have extensively used shuffleboard for PID tuning, telemetry, etc but this year, whenever we go to edit a value in shuffleboard, it does not update in network tables at all. Elastic works just fine. Below is a thread with others having the same problem.

Shuffleboard inputs no longer working Programming

And this isn’t very promising for continued use this season. This has led us to transferring over to elastic.

Shuffleboard inputs no longer working Programming

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked:
We’ve been using Shuffleboard for a while now until this year we are switching to Elastic, The reason behind this is that Shuffleboard isn’t monitored as much as Elastic, Elastic receives updates constantly, Even though both function the same but we felt that Elastic is much smoother and doesn’t have many issues, And one main reason we switched is that this year’s Shuffleboard has an issue where the widgets don’t update when we change values live which made it harder for us to tune values (PIDFF/Motor speeds…)

In the end it really depends on what you like because both apps work the same way.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Note we fixed this in Shuffleboard 2025.3.1 by reverting to the 2024 implementation.

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: elastic also displays stuff prettier imo

posts.cooked: That’s why we switched, so much nicer on the eyes.

posts.name: Dan
posts.cooked:
Just yesterday our students were complaining that the laptop was experiencing horrible lag when typing… and sure enough someone had accidentally left Shuffleboard open. Close it, system (mostly) returns to normal.

Elastic for drive team, Glass/Advantagekit for diagnostics.

posts.name: Oliver
posts.cooked:
tekdemo:

Elastic for drive team, Glass/Advantagekit for diagnostics.

do you mean advantagescope?

(Extremely late reply, lol. Apologies)

Thanks so much for the reply! I didn’t realize that the Elastic version that is bundled with WPILib is not updated, so I installed the file that was found on your GitHub. Once we had an updated copy, our camera was working at a much more smoother rate. I was very happy to see this working, and our team has made a full migration from Shuffleboard to Elastic for this year.

Keep up the good work, you’ve done a very nice job with Elastic. The only thing I hope to see in the future is grid layouts get added. Otherwise, it’s way more usable than Shuffleboard and has made our lives a lot easier.
